p: Coagulopathy associated with elevated D-dimer has been observed in COVID-19; this is consistently associated with multiorgan failure and poor outcome [ 76, 77]. It is well-known that increased production of fibrinogen, factor VIII, and von Willebrand factor along with impaired fibrinolysis in CS also gives rise to a pro-thrombotic state. This risk could possibly be aggravated if infected with SARS-CoV-2 [ 78].
